postsData.name:

postsData.content:
The Ultimate Career Growth Guide for New Hires

(Growth secrets nobody tells you about)

The first 90 days can make or break your reputation at work.

Those who stay silent in new jobs watch opportunities pass them by.

Here's the reality:
Your daily moves shape how fast you climb the ladder.

Here are 7 career-boosting moves that turn new hires into standouts:

1Ô∏è‚É£ Take Notes Like a Pro
‚Ü≥ Keep track of everything others forget.
‚Ü≥ Share the gold nuggets from every meeting.
Win: You become the go-to person for important info.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Keep Your Wins Handy
‚Ü≥ Save emails where people praise your work.
‚Ü≥ Keep a list of problems you've crushed.
Win: You have solid proof of your success when review time comes.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Make Friends Everywhere
‚Ü≥ Chat with people from different teams.
‚Ü≥ Find the helpers who make things happen.
Win: You get things done faster because you know who to ask.

4Ô∏è‚É£ Level Up Like a Gamer
‚Ü≥ Hunt for feedback like power-ups.
‚Ü≥ Show everyone how fast you learn.
Win: You grow skills quicker than others and stand out.

5Ô∏è‚É£ Be the Problem Solver
‚Ü≥ Jump on problems before they grow.
‚Ü≥ Make your boss's headaches disappear.
Win: You become too valuable to ignore.

6Ô∏è‚É£ Play the Long Game
‚Ü≥ Help others shine and they'll remember.
‚Ü≥ Build bridges before you need them.
Win: People want to help you because you helped them first.

7Ô∏è‚É£ Master Your Time
‚Ü≥ Beat deadlines, not just meet them.
‚Ü≥ Always have room for urgent stuff.
Win: You look super reliable and get picked for better projects.

Remember:
Every move you make shows others what you're made of.

Today's small wins build tomorrow's big breaks.

Which of these moves helped you level up fastest?
Let me know in the comments below ‚¨á

 Repost if you found this insightful!
 Followfor more!

65 million of them are decision-makers.

‚Üí This makes it a total NO BRAINER to build on this platform.

Being active on this platform has enabled me to:

 Sell globally from day 1
‚Äç Work from wherever I want
 Partner with incredible companies
 Grow my business with multiple 6 figures through LinkedIn
 Build an audience of 211,000+ followers and 92 million impressions
 Been featured in Entrepreneur and Inc Magazine (+ Times Square)

But you don't need a big audience to do well here.....

You just need 3 things:

‚Üí know WHO you want to reach
‚Üí and HOW to add value to them
‚Üí and be consistent

That's it.

‚Üí Your personal brand DRIVES your business.

Let's build our own MOMENTUM 

And avoid missing out on this massive opportunity.

Ani Filipova
postsData.content:
No one cares about your career more than you.
Take ownership. Make moves. Control the narrative.

Shout out tofor this cheat sheet and the information 
The sooner you learn these 12 rules, the better.

1Ô∏è‚É£ Hard Work Isn‚Äôt Enough
Results need to be seen. If you don‚Äôt advocate for yourself, no one else will.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Loyalty Won‚Äôt Pay the Bills
Companies are loyal to profits, not people. Look out for yourself first.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Your Job Title Is Temporary
Titles mean nothing. Skills are everything. Build them relentlessly.

4Ô∏è‚É£ Your Boss Isn‚Äôt Always Right
Blind obedience won‚Äôt get you ahead. Challenge when it matters.

5Ô∏è‚É£ Networking Is Non-Negotiable
Your skills open doors. Your network holds the keys.

6Ô∏è‚É£ Burnout Is Not a Badge of Honor
Work smarter. Protect your energy. No one wins from exhaustion.

7Ô∏è‚É£ Comfort Zones Kill Growth
If you‚Äôre not uncomfortable, you‚Äôre not growing. Period.

8Ô∏è‚É£ Feedback Is a Gift
Harsh feedback stings. But it will make you sharper. Seek it out.

9Ô∏è‚É£ You‚Äôre Always Replaceable
Your impact outweighs your job title. Focus on your legacy.

 Perfection Slows You Down
Perfection is procrastination in disguise. Done > Perfect.

1Ô∏è‚É£1Ô∏è‚É£ Career Progress Isn‚Äôt Linear
Side steps and failures often lead to the biggest wins.

1Ô∏è‚É£2Ô∏è‚É£ No One Will Hand You Success
Waiting won‚Äôt get you anywhere. Take control.

Which truth hits you the hardest? Drop the number in the comments.

Ô∏è Repost this to help someone take control of their career.
 Followfor more high-performance career insights.

Kiflo turns 6! 

I can‚Äôt believe it‚Äôs already been 6 years‚Ä¶

It‚Äôs been a wild, exciting, and challenging ride, filled with lessons at every turn‚Äîbut every step has been worth it.

Over these years, we‚Äôve:

- Worked hard to build the best Partner Management Platform possible.
- Constantly developed, optimized, and (let‚Äôs be honest) refactored our tech to keep improving.
- Helped our customers grow their partner programs and achieve their goals.
-  Built an incredible team and learned how to grow together.
-  Refined our acquisition and sales process.
- Nailed our customer onboarding experience.
- Launched a partner program with outstanding partners.
- Tested bold strategies to grow‚Äîsome worked, others didn‚Äôt, but we took every lesson to heart.
-  Started laying the groundwork for the future because exciting things are on the horizon!

Kiflo has always been about partnerships‚Äînot just for our customers but within our team and with everyone who‚Äôs supported us on this adventure.

To our amazing customers, dedicated team, partners, and everyone who‚Äôs been part of this journey: sincerely, thank you! 

We wouldn‚Äôt be here without you.

Everything is still to come!

postsData.name:
Rachel Park
Rachel Park
postsData.content:
9 Brutal Career Truths for Female Leaders 
(and the Power Moves to Overcome Them)

50% of women leave Tech before age 35.

Women aren't failing to lead.
They're fighting invisible battles daily.

These battles show up as:
- Exhausting self-doubt
- Constant second-guessing
- The pressure to prove yourself

But here's the thing:
These challenges aren't your imagination.
They're systemic barriers you can navigate with grace.


Here are some brutal career truths for women:
(And how you can overcome them)

1. Feeling Invisible in Male-Dominated Rooms
‚Üí Your ideas get overlooked in meetings and discussions
‚Üí Build alliances and follow up with written proposals

2. Pressure to 'Fit In' Over Standing Out
‚Üí You dim your light to avoid making others uncomfortable
‚Üí Let your authentic leadership style become your strength

3. Struggling to Secure Leadership Roles
‚Üí Your proven results don't translate to promotions
‚Üí Find sponsors who will advocate for your advancement

4. Work-Life Balance Guilt
‚Üí You feel pulled between career success and personal peace
‚Üí Create boundaries that protect your energy and growth

5. Imposter Syndrome in High-Stakes Roles
‚Üí You question your abilities despite proven success
‚Üí Focus on your impact rather than internal doubts

6. Navigating Unconscious Bias in Decisions
‚Üí Key opportunities pass you by without clear reason
‚Üí Document your achievements and request stretch assignments

7. Limited Role Models at the Top
‚Üí You can't find leaders who look like you
‚Üí Build connections with peers facing similar challenges

8. Constantly Proving Competence
‚Üí Your expertise gets questioned more than your peers
‚Üí Track your wins and share successes systematically

9. Balancing Assertiveness Without Being Labeled
‚Üí Your directness gets misread as aggression
‚Üí Stay firm while using collaborative communication styles


Facing these barriers isn‚Äôt easy.

But you do have the power to overcome them with grace.


Which truth resonates most with your journey? Share below 


 If you enjoyed this content, you might like my newsletter here:

____

 Follow mefor more posts on career & wellbeing.
Ô∏è Repost to support your network.

postsData.name:
Jeffrey Ross
Jeffrey Ross
postsData.content:
Renting Your Property? 

Learn How Accommodation Sharing Affects Your Taxes! 

Whether you‚Äôre renting out a room or an entire property, it's important to understand how income from accommodation sharing impacts your taxes.

What is Accommodation Sharing?
‚Ü≥ Accommodation sharing involves renting part or all of a property for a short period.
‚Ü≥ This can include your primary or secondary residence.
‚Ü≥ It also includes rentals facilitated by third-party platforms like Airbnb, CanadaStays, FlipKey, and VRBO.

Income Tax on Accommodation Sharing
‚Ü≥ Any income you earn from accommodation sharing is subject to income tax.
‚Ü≥ The CRA will classify this income as either rental income or self-employment business income, based on the services you provide to tenants.

Determining Rental or Business Income
‚Ü≥ Rental Income: If you offer basic services, such as heat, utilities, parking, and laundry facilities, your income is generally considered rental income.
‚Ü≥ Business Income: If you offer additional services like meals, cleaning, or security, your income is likely to be classified as self-employment business income.
The more services you provide, the more likely it is that your income will be treated as business income.

Example of Rental Income vs. Business Income
‚Ü≥ Charles: Rents out his property on Airbnb and includes meals, cleaning, and tour services. This would be considered business income.
‚Ü≥ Ren√©e: Rents out a property and only provides basic services like accommodation, heat, and parking. This would generally be considered rental income.

Reporting Rental Income
‚Ü≥ If your accommodation sharing income is considered rental income, you need to report it on your income tax return and complete Form T776, Statement of Real Estate Rentals.
‚Ü≥ If it‚Äôs considered self-employment business income, report it on your income tax return and file Form T2125, Statement of Business or Professional Activities.

Deducting Rental Expenses
‚Ü≥ You can deduct reasonable expenses you incur to earn rental income.
‚Ü≥ If you rent only part of a property, such as a room, you can only claim expenses related to the rented portion.

GST/HST Obligations for Accommodation Sharing
‚Ü≥ Short-term accommodations (less than 1 month) are subject to GST/HST. However, rentals lasting 1 month or more are exempt from this tax.
‚Ü≥ If you earn more than $30,000 in gross revenue over four calendar quarters from accommodation sharing, you must register, collect, and remit GST/HST to the CRA.

GST/HST Input Tax Credits (ITCs)
‚Ü≥ If you register to collect GST/HST, even if your income is below $30,000, you can claim Input Tax Credits (ITCs).
‚Ü≥ This allows you to reduce the amount of GST/HST you owe, similar to how you can deduct rental expenses for income tax purposes.


Closing Tip
‚Ü≥ Keep detailed records of all your rental income and related expenses. The CRA may ask to see these documents.

Have questions or need assistance? Let‚Äôs connect!

comments.commentText: Keeping detailed records and staying compliant with tax regulations can save a lot of headaches down the line.

postsData.commentAdded: Great insights on a crucial topic! Understanding tax implications can make a huge difference for property owners. Thanks for sharing!

postsData.name:
Stav Vaisman
Stav Vaisman
postsData.content:
It's fascinating to watch how Gen Z engage with brands.

They don't just listen to what we say - they watch what we do:

- How we treat our employees
- Where we source our materials
- What causes we quietly support
- How we respond in difficult moments
- Who makes our key decisions

This changes everything about purpose-driven marketing.

Your brand's purpose isn't just a statement crafted in a boardroom. It's alive in every decision you make, every policy you implement, and every person you hire.

Gen Z has shown us that purpose needs to flow through an organization like DNA - present in every cell, guiding every action.

They're looking for consistency, not perfection. Real effort, not polished statements.

This shift can make you a better marketer.

A better business.

A better leader.

Because when purpose moves from your mission statements into your daily decisions, something remarkable happens:

You build trust that lasts.

comments.commentText: This perfectly captures why authenticity is non-negotiable in today‚Äôs market. Gen Z can spot insincerity a mile away.
Love seeing businesses adapt to these meaningful changes.

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely agree! Gen Zs demand for authenticity is redefining how we approach brand purpose. Its all about genuine action over mere words! üåü

postsData.name:
Priyank Ahuja
Priyank Ahuja
postsData.content:
Are you struggling to get resume shortlist?

Resume shortlisting is the first step in the recruiting process. And if you have not been FORMATTING it right, how will you pass stage 1 of the race?

Fix it now before it's too late.

I'm here to help, here's how to do it right.

Ô∏è Choose a clean layout

Go for an uncomplicated and chronological template that is easy to comprehend and navigate.

- Name & Contact
- Education
- Experience
- Extra Curricular /Certifications
- Skills

Ô∏è Keep it concise

- Short descriptions of your experience in pointers rather than writing in paragraphs.

- Delete unnecessary information that is irrelevant to the role you're applying for.

- Only include recent and remarkable work experience. Don't add any experience that is more than 4 years old.

Ô∏è Let your resume breathe

- Add tables for each heading.

- Leave some space after the margins of the table lines, the borders and after each table.

- Don't clutter the boxes with numerous pointers. Keep 2- 3 pointers at maximum.

Ô∏è Make it ATS friendly

To save time, companies have resorted to running all your resumes through Applicant Tracking System or ATS.

To stand out, use keywords.

- Directly from the job description.
- Don't use keywords inappropriately, that is, out of context.
- Don't overuse them.

For example:
Requirement: HR Manager

Your Experience:

HR Executive at XYZ
- Managed the recruitment and selection process
- Supervised HR Coordinator and tracked the performance of employees
- Improved employee satisfaction by 25% etc

Ô∏è Follow reverse chronological order

- Always start from your recent achievements/experience / educational qualification.

For example:

Sales Intern at XYZ
- Led a team of 7 members and contributed to 40% of the raised funds for x event in June 2023
- Converted 100+ leads in 2 weeks in April 2023

Some Tips:

 Don't use different fonts and text colours. Stick to one font and size throughout.
For example, Times New Roman and size 12.

 Don't use bold or italics excessively. Only use it for headings.

 Use short sentences and bullet points.

 Limit your resume to 1 page only.

Leave your best advice for anyone who's applying for a job in the comments. 

Follow

comments.commentText:
Great tips Priyank for a standout resume! 

Keeping it clean, concise, and ATS-friendly is key to getting noticed.

I'd like to add that tailoring your resume for each position is crucial. Highlighting relevant experiences and aligning your skills with the job description can significantly improve your chances of getting shortlisted.

postsData.commentAdded: Great tips on resume formatting! A well-structured and concise resume can truly make a difference in getting noticed. Thanks for sharing!

postsData.content:
Starting over isn‚Äôt a setback‚Äîit‚Äôs a setup for your next big success. 

I know because I did it.

At 43, after losing my corporate job, I didn‚Äôt just rebuild; I built something better‚Äîa career I‚Äôm proud of, aligned with my passion and purpose.

To everyone starting over, here‚Äôs my best career advice:

1Ô∏è‚É£ Embrace what you‚Äôve been through‚Äîit‚Äôs what makes you unique and valuable.

2Ô∏è‚É£ You are the CEO of you. Start showing up online, sharing your expertise, and positioning yourself as the expert you are.

3Ô∏è‚É£ The first step is always the scariest, but it‚Äôs also the most important. Apply for the job, pitch the client, or write the book‚Äîyour future self will thank you.

Starting over doesn‚Äôt mean starting from scratch.
You‚Äôre bringing everything you‚Äôve learned with you.

What advice would YOU give to someone starting over?

Share it below‚ÄîI‚Äôd love to hear your wisdom!

Ready to get started:

postsData.name:
Ryan Sick
Ryan Sick
postsData.content:
Most people would have given up.

Most people would have let the pain, the loss, and the overwhelming challenge define them.

But not Johnny.

Johnny was an All-Pro tri-athlete in baseball, basketball, and football. He thrived on adrenaline, living life to the max.

But years ago, a tragic accident took one of his legs.

Doctors told his family he had only hours to live.
He died on the operating table - multiple times.

Doctors told him his life would never be the same.
They weren‚Äôt wrong‚Ä¶

Because Johnny didn‚Äôt just ‚Äúrecover.‚Äù He rebuilt himself into something stronger.

Ô∏è He learned how to move, train, and adapt again.
Ô∏è He tackles home renovations like nothing changed.
Ô∏è He mows his lawn with a push mower - while wheeling around in his wheelchair.
Ô∏è He‚Äôs climbing ladders, working on his roof, jet skiing, swimming, driving - you name it.

This man is a warrior in every sense of the word.
His perseverance and resilience is truly remarkable.

He refused to let his circumstances define his life. Instead, he chose to define his future.

Because overcoming injuries isn‚Äôt just about healing your body. It‚Äôs about breaking through the mental and emotional barriers that try to keep you stuck.

This is exactly what Johnny did and he's an inspiration for us all. 

My mission is to help people like Johnny reclaim their strength and live a life without limits.

I‚Äôm a strength & conditioning specialist with 20+ years of experience helping people overcome injuries, break through physical & mental barriers, and live a life fueled by purpose, driven by determination.

You don‚Äôt have to accept limits.
You don‚Äôt have to settle for what they say you ‚Äúcan‚Äôt‚Äù do.

Your story isn't over. Let's write your next chapter. 

‚Üí Get Started.

Johnny's journey exemplifies the strength of resilience and determination. His ability to overcome physical and mental challenges is truly inspiring. We all have the power to rise above and redefine our paths
Anas Ahmed Khan we all have the power to rise above and redefine our paths!  Love that. Johnny‚Äôs story proves that mindset is everything. When you refuse to accept limits, anything is possible.

His journey is a testament to the power of resilience and determination. 

It's so inspiring to see how he rebuilt himself and refused to be defined by his challenges. 

, your mission to help others reclaim their strength is truly impactful.

And also your body ain't no joke
Favour Jim appreciate that!  Johnny‚Äôs story is proof that limits are meant to be broken. Resilience changes everything.

postsData.commentAdded: Incredible story, Johnny! Your strength and determination inspire us all to push beyond limits. Heres to redefining what‚Äôs possible! üí™ #Resilience

postsData.name:
Jeff Mains
Jeff Mains
postsData.content:
Startups are brutally hard, and most fail.
That‚Äôs why leadership is a two-way street.

‚Üí Take care of your team. Listen to their needs. Give them what they need to succeed.
‚Üí But also demand their best. Push for excellence. Expect accountability.
You cannot build a strong culture without accountability.

Without it, high performers get frustrated, and low performers drag the team down.

Mistakes will happen‚Äîthat‚Äôs part of the game.
But in a startup, every mistake needs to move you forward, not sideways.

comments.commentText: Great point! A balance of support and accountability is important for building a strong, thriving startup culture.

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely agree! Balancing support and accountability is key in fostering a resilient team culture. Lets push for excellence together! üí™‚ú®

postsData.name:
Don Drury
Don Drury
postsData.content:
These last few years have helped me understand my personal true north and values with a new level of clarity, and for that I am grateful. 

Recent discussions around DEI and meritocracy have me thinking about how we define "merit" as a filter. Ability to understand the nuances of a given role and effectively take on the responsibilities and stewardship of the role, achieve results, and "get it done" seem to fit. For many positions this requires both emotional and intellectual intelligence. It may include investing in and supporting people willing to learn and grow into a given role (tightly aligned with accountability). In the military it may require a vow to follow orders without question, unless those orders become so egregious and morally bankrupt that individuals choose to stand down. A question to ponder: are there any circumstances where blind loyalty to a leader, company, party or cause are acceptable as one of the "merits" used to hire, fire, appoint and recommend people in the public or commercial sector?
postsData.commentAdded: Your insights into merit and accountability are thought-provoking! It‚Äôs crucial to re-evaluate what true merit means in today‚Äôs context.

postsData.name:
J.P. Singh
J.P. Singh
postsData.content:
Platform Features Don't Impress Merchants: The End of the Platform Comparison Wars 

After working with countless merchants and brands, one truth stands out: eCommerce success isn‚Äôt about platform features. It‚Äôs about business outcomes.

Yet, we‚Äôve been caught in platform comparison wars‚ÄîAdobe Commerce vs. Magento vs. Shopify, BigCommerce vs. WooCommerce, headless vs. monolithic. Each side boasting features, flexibility, and scalability. But here‚Äôs the hard truth:
 76% of eCommerce decision-makers say they prioritize revenue growth over platform capabilities. (Source: Forrester)
 Only 17% of merchants believe switching platforms significantly impacts customer experience. (Source: Baymard Institute)
 85% of businesses consider security and compliance a top priority when choosing an eCommerce solution. (Source: Cybersecurity Ventures)
Features don‚Äôt sell. Business results do.

What truly matters for merchants?
 Growth ‚Äì More revenue, better margins.
 Efficiency ‚Äì Less friction, fewer headaches.
 Control ‚Äì Full ownership over their data and store operations.
 Security ‚Äì Protection against fraud, data breaches, and cyber threats.
 Easy Integration ‚Äì Seamless connections between ERP, CRM, payment gateways, and logistics.
 Quality of Work ‚Äì A stable, scalable platform that supports long-term growth without constant fixes.

eCommerce platforms are tools, not strategies. Merchants aren‚Äôt asking, "Does this platform have X feature?" They‚Äôre asking:
 "Will this help me scale my business?"
 "Can I reach new customers?"
 "Will it make my operations smoother?"
 "Do I have full control over my store and customer data?"
 "How secure is my store against cyber threats?"

The future of eCommerce isn‚Äôt about winning platform debates. It‚Äôs about delivering results. Whether it‚Äôs Adobe Commerce, Magento, BigCommerce, Shopify Plus, or headless solutions, the real question is: Which ecosystem empowers success while offering control, security, and easy integration?

Let‚Äôs move beyond platform superiority and start focusing on merchant success. 

What are your thoughts? Let‚Äôs discuss in the comments!

comments.commentText: J.P. Singh Spot on! Great post! The endless platform comparison debates often miss the bigger picture‚Äîbusiness outcomes. Merchants don‚Äôt just need features; they need growth, efficiency, security, and control etc... The right platform is the one that enables success, not just checks feature boxes. Time to shift the focus from tech specs to tangible results!
Agree with you J.P. Singh most of the merchants looks for growth and rest things start coming once they have grown at a size and then it starts with comparison and all other factors.

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely agree! Its essential to prioritize outcomes over features. Merchants need solutions that drive growth and efficiency! #eCommerceSuccess
